title: India’s Government Must Defend Taxpayers, Not Foreign Investors
content: Foreign companies have reaped enormous profits from India’s fast-growing digital economy while paying little or no tax by channeling investments through offshore entities. A landmark Supreme Court ruling challenges this model, but the government’s trade agenda pulls in the opposite direction.
creator: Jayati Ghosh
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Could a BRICS Currency Work?
content: Economists have long dismissed the idea that a BRICS common currency could challenge the US dollar's role in the global economy, and for good reason. But that doesn't mean there couldn't be new common rails for settling trade between countries that want to escape the long arm of the US government.
creator: Jim O'Neill
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: NATO’s Next Test
content: If NATO is serious about managing the Russian threat identified in its own strategy documents, it must focus its efforts where deterrence is most fragile. Lithuania's plans for a new training ground near the Suwałki corridor are thus a test case for assessing US and European resolve.
creator: Agnia Grigas
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: When Mining Companies Leave, African Communities Pay
content: For decades, multinational mining companies have extracted tens of billions of dollars in profits across Africa, while sidestepping environmental and fiscal costs and leaving host communities to foot the bill. Without reliable accountability mechanisms, the clean-energy transition risks following the same trajectory.
creator: Christopher Rutledge
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump the Rebel King
content: As a chief law-enforcement officer who has deployed gangs of criminal thugs to opposition-led cities and sued a government agency that he oversees for $10 billion, US President Donald Trump has taken the exercise of power to its most absurd extreme. He rules a state that he seeks to destroy.
creator: Slavoj Žižek
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Africa Must Achieve Health Sovereignty Before the Next Pandemic
content: Following the outbreak of COVID-19, the Africa Centres for Disease Control received an influx of external funding to strengthen its capacity, facilitate local vaccine manufacturing, and build robust genomic networks across the continent. To prepare for the next pandemic, African governments must commit to supporting these efforts.
creator: John Nkengasong
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe’s Reckoning with Fossil-Fuel Insecurity
content: US President Donald Trump’s interventionist foreign policy will force European leaders to reconsider their dependence on American LNG supplies at the Munich Security Conference. But true energy security requires recognizing and addressing the insecurities associated with the use of hydrocarbons.
creator: Pauline Sophie Heinrichs
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Midterm Election Won’t Fix US Politics
content: US voters may well embrace the Democratic Party in this year’s midterm elections. But neither that outcome nor the 2028 election is likely to lead to a realignment of US politics that delivers a government capable of sustaining policies long enough to address the problems the country faces.
creator: David W. Brady
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why the High Seas Treaty Matters for Everyone
content: When Malawi became the first landlocked country to ratify the High Seas Treaty, it helped redefine what ocean stewardship looks like. The issue is not defined by proximity to the sea, but by a willingness to act in the common interest by safeguarding humanity’s shared life-support system.
creator: Arthur Peter Mutharika
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why Trump Let Nuclear Arms Control Die
content: The lapse of New START makes one thing clear: US President Donald Trump’s willingness to break commitments is a problem for the entire planet. Nuclear stability was built over decades by institutions designed to make the future legible, and now it is being unmade by a leader who sees no value in keeping his word.
creator: Stephen Holmes
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: What the West Gets Wrong About Chinese Manufacturing
content: The Western consensus on how to erode China's industrial dominance and "de-risk" supply chains deserves a harder look. Reducing dependence on China is not as simple as switching a few suppliers; it demands the cultivation of comparable industrial density, including supplier networks, skills, tooling, and patient finance.
creator: Robin Rivaton
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump’s Trade Truce Won’t Restore the US-India Relationship
content: With the announcement of an interim trade deal between the US and India, hopes are high that the bruising confrontation initiated by President Donald Trump last year is coming to an end. But while the deal may ease tensions, trust – the essential currency of any strategic partnership – is unlikely to be restored any time soon.
creator: Brahma Chellaney
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The World Needs Europe to Get Its Act Together – Fast
content: If Europe is to assert itself on the global stage, as it should, it needs to restore its self-confidence. Many yearn for an alternative to the US and Chinese models, and for that, Europe’s leaders must have the courage to chart their own course.
creator: Dani Rodrik
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Back to Space for India
content: Three failed missions in a year have created a reputational crisis for the Indian Space Research Organization, jeopardizing India’s position in a crowded commercial market. Given the ISRO’s critical role in supporting development, innovation, security, and national pride, the agency needs to pursue a strategic reset.
creator: Shashi Tharoor
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: What Trump Wants from Russia
content: In a world of asymmetrical power dynamics and deep interdependencies, the only path to stability lies in binding rules, credible institutions, and enduring alliances. Donald Trump’s rejection of this basic truth – reflected in his dealings with Russia – augurs an age of volatility from which China will emerge a clear winner.
creator: Ana Palacio
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Eve of Destruction
content: In all the countries surveyed for the Munich Security Index 2026, the downsides of US President Donald Trump’s wrecking-ball politics dominate public perceptions. But the rest of the world is not helpless, so long as governments develop and pool their power resources and demonstrate that meaningful reforms are possible.
creator: Tobias Bunde
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Overlooked Threat to the Fed’s Mission
content: It might come as a surprise to many to learn that the US Treasury is not required to recapitalize the Federal Reserve even if the central bank’s losses could prevent it from making its contractual payments or effectively pursuing its policy mandates. Unfortunately, this vulnerability has begun to matter more than it once did.
creator: Willem H. Buiter
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The New Nuclear Challenge
content: With the end of the New START Treaty last week, it is now clear that the world has grown too comfortable with nuclear weapons. Given the risks posed by larger arsenals, and even more so by new additions to the nuclear club, the time to become uncomfortable again has arrived.
creator: Richard Haass
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Takaichi on Top
content: Japanese Prime Minister Takaichi Sanae gambled big when she called an early election to strengthen her mandate. Now that her bet has paid off with an overwhelming victory and a huge majority in the Diet's lower house, what will she do next?
creator: Taniguchi Tomohiko
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: What Are Kevin Warsh’s Priorities?
content: President Donald Trump’s pick to take over as chair of the Federal Reserve in May is preoccupied with moral hazard, the concern that Fed balance-sheet expansion encourages risky behavior by banks, inflates asset prices, and promotes fiscal profligacy. But while moral-hazard risk is a valid concern, so is financial-meltdown risk.
creator: Barry Eichengreen
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: A Path to Universal Prosperity by 2100
content: Over the past century, economic growth has delivered higher incomes and longer lives, while empowering millions of people. Looking to the future, a world where everyone can live securely and with options – as opposed to just subsisting – is within reach, but will require emerging economies to continue expanding.
creator: Marc Canal Noguer
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Kevin Warsh’s Dangerous Monetary Nostalgia
content: The next US Federal Reserve chair seems to think that the large size of the central bank’s balance sheet reflects a discretionary policy choice which can and should be reversed. In reality, however, the Fed's balance sheet has become part of the financial system’s core infrastructure, and shrinking it would carry serious risks.
creator: Lucrezia Reichlin
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe Should Reject US-Style Competitiveness
content: European leaders seem increasingly convinced that, to succeed in the 21st century, they must reshape Europe's economy in America’s image. But the American brand of "competitiveness" contributes to major imbalances and far-reaching harm, which the European Union can avoid by embracing effective competition policy.
creator: Sandeep Vaheesan
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page
